title: Excessive memory usage
content: Upgraded my Mac to Apple OS TAHOE 26.0.1 and upgraded to Firefox 144.0.2 (aarch 64). Upon opening Firefox, the application hogs my computer's 8 GB memory, taking 6.3-7.9 gigs (!!!) with only one tab opened! When I try to browse and use it, it often freezes and for the first time in using MACs for 40 years I got a warning for excessive memory usage and prompt to force quit other apps. Firefox in this version is practically unusable (unless I get 16 gigs of memory!) I think guys that this version uses an excessive amount of resources, needs serious "diet" and compacting. Please fix our favorite browser in a trimmer new version. Or after 30 years nearly I (and many others with * gig machines) will have to switch default browser, not my favorite solution for sure
creator: mrkiakidis

title: No guarda contraseñas.
content: Firefox me tiene aburrido. Después de actualizar a la versión 14.03, comenzaron los problemas, (no guarda contraseñas) Llevo con este problema más de un mes. Repito todo fue después de actualizar. Cuando inicio la actualización a versión 14.03, la pantalla vi que hizo una cosa extraña. Y la finalizar la actualización comenzó el problema de (no guarda contraseñas) En un mes he hecho de todo, configuraciones, desinstalar FireFox y reinstalar, antes de nueva instalación he borrado carpetas de FireFox he limpiado el registro, en resume he hecho de todo y el problema de guardar contraseñas sigue, me tiene aburrido el FireFox. Siempre he preferido este navegador, desde hace mas de 30 años, pero veo que el problema persiste, así que abandonare FireFox y me pasare a Chrome He instalado Chrome y no tiene problemas, he exportado contraseñas a un fichero *.csv He importado este fichero a Firefox y lo importa sin ningún problema y al hacer clic contraseñas se ven 81 contraseñas guardadas, pero cuando cierro Firefox y abro de nuevo, las contraseñas guardas hace unos segundos hago clic en contraseñas y sale diciendo, no hay contraseñas guardadas. Repito esto ocurre desde la actualización, que repito vi en la pantalla algo extraño, durante el proceso de actualización. He escaneado con antivirus Norton con licencia, y no detecta virus. Resumen, en un mes he hecho de todo, ya se que soy un cabezón que quiero arreglar estos problemas que tengo con FireFox. Con otro navegador (Chrome) no tengo problemas, pero me gusta más Firefox. Espero que me puedan ayudar. Saludos, desde Madrid (España)
creator: ramonesq

title: Firefox fails after updating
content: I have just started a new job and installed the Firefox browser on my PC (W11) as part of setting up my new workstation. The application works fine until I get a message that Firefox needs to install an update, 'please close it or it will close automatically in one hour'. After the update I get a message that the update is complete and you can restart the application, but the application no longer works; the icon on the application list no longer works 'The item firefox.exe that this shortcut refers to has been changed or moved'. After re-installing Firefox it works OK again, but the process repeats. Although I have managed to succesfully update a new installation on two occasions, after a few days the process repeats and I need to re-install again.
creator: richard0001

title: Clear history is not working
content:
Firefox is not deleting search history when using Clear Recent History. The URLs still appear in the Show All History.

In Settings under Privacy and Security, the box is ticked for Delete cookies and site data, and also for Clear history when Firefox closes. I have manually cleared cookies and site data and history within Settings, but the it still remains under History even when I've closed Firefox and restarted the PC.

Under Sync, the box for History is not ticked.

This has been happening for some time without me realising. I have now deleted pages.sqlite and this has cleared the history, but it still retains all new site data under History and will not clear it.

I have disabled then uninstalled anti-virus, I have removed CCleaner because this was also not deleting history.

And I've also reinstalled Firefox, but the problem persists.

What am I doing wrong please?

I am using Windows 11.
creator: lemm
